title: Cant compile from scratch with either gcc 5.3.0  or 6.4.0
body_html:
If you have a question or would like help and support, please ask at our
forums.

If you are submitting a feature request, please preface the title with [feature request].
If you are submitting a bug report, please fill in the following details.

Issue description

Can't build with:
Currently Loaded Modulefiles:

  1. anaconda/2.7-4.3.1 2) cudnn/6.0 3) cuda/8.0 4) protobuf/3.6.1 5) gcc/6.4.0

in:
uname -a
Linux compute-5-7.local 3.10.107-1.el6.elrepo.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Jun 27 10:57:54 EDT 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

Provide a short description.
Can't build from source, using either gcc/5.3.0 or 5.4.0 using the same environent as above.

Code example

Here's the entire build output:
http://termbin.com/pk29

The last few lines of the output are:
data/apps/sources/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/onnx/onnx_onnx_torch.pb.h:2401:10: error: 'PROTOBUF_CONSTEXPR' does not name a type static PROTOBUF_CONSTEXPR int const kIndexInFileMessages = ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ /data/apps/sources/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/onnx/onnx_onnx_torch.pb.h:2542:10: error: 'PROTOBUF_CONSTEXPR' does not name a type static PROTOBUF_CONSTEXPR int const kIndexInFileMessages = ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ /data/apps/sources/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/onnx/onnx_onnx_torch.pb.h:5828:121: error: expected class-name before '{' token template <> struct is_proto_enum< ::onnx_torch::AttributeProto_AttributeType> : ::google::protobuf::internal::true_type {}; ^ /data/apps/sources/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/onnx/onnx_onnx_torch.pb.h:5833:113: error: expected class-name before '{' token template <> struct is_proto_enum< ::onnx_torch::TensorProto_DataType> : ::google::protobuf::internal::true_type {}; ^ /data/apps/sources/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/onnx/onnx_onnx_torch.pb.h:5838:100: error: expected class-name before '{' token template <> struct is_proto_enum< ::onnx_torch::Version> : ::google::protobuf::internal::true_type {}; ^ cc1plus: warning: unrecognized command line option '-Wno-stringop-overflow' cc1plus: warning: unrecognized command line option '-Wno-zero-length-array' error: command '/data/apps/gcc/6.4.0/bin/gcc' failed with exit status 1

Please try to provide a minimal example to repro the bug.
Error messages and stack traces are also helpful.

System Info

Please copy and paste the output from our
environment collection script

The script fails immediately - no torch, which I expected to be included in the pytorch distribution..?

(or fill out the checklist below manually).

You can get the script and run it with:

  • PyTorch or Caffe2:
    pytorch, recent git checkout

  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source):
    python setup.py install

  • Build command you used (if compiling from source):

  • OS:
    CentOS 6.9 Linux, kernel 3.10.107-1.el6.elrepo.x86_64

  • PyTorch version:

  • Python version:
    anaconda/2.7-4.3.1

  • CUDA/cuDNN version:

cudnn/6.0 3) cuda/8.0

  • GPU models and configuration:
    NVIDIA Corporation GP104 [GeForce GTX 1080] (rev a1)

  • GCC version (if compiling from source):
    5.3.0, 6.4.0

  • CMake version:
    3.6.1

  • Versions of any other relevant libraries:
    protobuf/3.6.1
body_text:
If you have a question or would like help and support, please ask at our
forums.
If you are submitting a feature request, please preface the title with [feature request].
If you are submitting a bug report, please fill in the following details.
Issue description
Can't build with:
Currently Loaded Modulefiles:

anaconda/2.7-4.3.1   2) cudnn/6.0            3) cuda/8.0             4) protobuf/3.6.1       5) gcc/6.4.0

in:
uname -a
Linux compute-5-7.local 3.10.107-1.el6.elrepo.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Jun 27 10:57:54 EDT 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
Provide a short description.
Can't build from source, using either gcc/5.3.0 or 5.4.0 using the same environent as above.
Code example
Here's the entire build output:
http://termbin.com/pk29
The last few lines of the output are:
data/apps/sources/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/onnx/onnx_onnx_torch.pb.h:2401:10: error: 'PROTOBUF_CONSTEXPR' does not name a type static PROTOBUF_CONSTEXPR int const kIndexInFileMessages = ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ /data/apps/sources/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/onnx/onnx_onnx_torch.pb.h:2542:10: error: 'PROTOBUF_CONSTEXPR' does not name a type static PROTOBUF_CONSTEXPR int const kIndexInFileMessages = ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ /data/apps/sources/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/onnx/onnx_onnx_torch.pb.h:5828:121: error: expected class-name before '{' token template <> struct is_proto_enum< ::onnx_torch::AttributeProto_AttributeType> : ::google::protobuf::internal::true_type {}; ^ /data/apps/sources/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/onnx/onnx_onnx_torch.pb.h:5833:113: error: expected class-name before '{' token template <> struct is_proto_enum< ::onnx_torch::TensorProto_DataType> : ::google::protobuf::internal::true_type {}; ^ /data/apps/sources/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/onnx/onnx_onnx_torch.pb.h:5838:100: error: expected class-name before '{' token template <> struct is_proto_enum< ::onnx_torch::Version> : ::google::protobuf::internal::true_type {}; ^ cc1plus: warning: unrecognized command line option '-Wno-stringop-overflow' cc1plus: warning: unrecognized command line option '-Wno-zero-length-array' error: command '/data/apps/gcc/6.4.0/bin/gcc' failed with exit status 1 
Please try to provide a minimal example to repro the bug.
Error messages and stack traces are also helpful.
System Info
Please copy and paste the output from our
environment collection script
The script fails immediately - no torch, which I expected to be included in the pytorch distribution..?
(or fill out the checklist below manually).
You can get the script and run it with:


PyTorch or Caffe2:
pytorch, recent git checkout


How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source):
python setup.py install


Build command you used (if compiling from source):


OS:
CentOS 6.9 Linux, kernel  3.10.107-1.el6.elrepo.x86_64


PyTorch version:


Python version:
anaconda/2.7-4.3.1


CUDA/cuDNN version:


cudnn/6.0            3) cuda/8.0


GPU models and configuration:
NVIDIA Corporation GP104 [GeForce GTX 1080] (rev a1)


GCC version (if compiling from source):
5.3.0, 6.4.0


CMake version:
3.6.1


Versions of any other relevant libraries:
protobuf/3.6.1
body:
If you have a question or would like help and support, please ask at our
[forums](https://discuss.pytorch.org/).

If you are submitting a feature request, please preface the title with [feature request].
If you are submitting a bug report, please fill in the following details.

## Issue description
Can't build with:
Currently Loaded Modulefiles:
  1) anaconda/2.7-4.3.1   2) cudnn/6.0            3) cuda/8.0             4) protobuf/3.6.1       5) gcc/6.4.0

in:
 uname -a
Linux compute-5-7.local 3.10.107-1.el6.elrepo.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Jun 27 10:57:54 EDT 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

Provide a short description.
Can't build from source, using either gcc/5.3.0 or 5.4.0 using the same environent as above.

## Code example
Here's the entire build output:
http://termbin.com/pk29

The last few lines of the output are:
`data/apps/sources/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/onnx/onnx_onnx_torch.pb.h:2401:10: error: 'PROTOBUF_CONSTEXPR' does not name a type
   static PROTOBUF_CONSTEXPR int const kIndexInFileMessages =
          ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
/data/apps/sources/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/onnx/onnx_onnx_torch.pb.h:2542:10: error: 'PROTOBUF_CONSTEXPR' does not name a type
   static PROTOBUF_CONSTEXPR int const kIndexInFileMessages =
          ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
/data/apps/sources/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/onnx/onnx_onnx_torch.pb.h:5828:121: error: expected class-name before '{' token
 template <> struct is_proto_enum< ::onnx_torch::AttributeProto_AttributeType> : ::google::protobuf::internal::true_type {};
                                                                                                                         ^
/data/apps/sources/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/onnx/onnx_onnx_torch.pb.h:5833:113: error: expected class-name before '{' token
 template <> struct is_proto_enum< ::onnx_torch::TensorProto_DataType> : ::google::protobuf::internal::true_type {};
                                                                                                                 ^
/data/apps/sources/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/onnx/onnx_onnx_torch.pb.h:5838:100: error: expected class-name before '{' token
 template <> struct is_proto_enum< ::onnx_torch::Version> : ::google::protobuf::internal::true_type {};
                                                                                                    ^
cc1plus: warning: unrecognized command line option '-Wno-stringop-overflow'
cc1plus: warning: unrecognized command line option '-Wno-zero-length-array'
error: command '/data/apps/gcc/6.4.0/bin/gcc' failed with exit status 1
`


Please try to provide a minimal example to repro the bug.
Error messages and stack traces are also helpful.

## System Info
Please copy and paste the output from our
[environment collection script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pytorch/pytorch/master/torch/utils/collect_env.py)

The script fails immediately - no torch, which I expected to be included in the pytorch distribution..?

(or fill out the checklist below manually).

You can get the script and run it with:

- PyTorch or Caffe2:
pytorch, recent git checkout

- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source):
python setup.py install

- Build command you used (if compiling from source):

- OS:
CentOS 6.9 Linux, kernel  3.10.107-1.el6.elrepo.x86_64
- PyTorch version:
- Python version:
anaconda/2.7-4.3.1
- CUDA/cuDNN version:

cudnn/6.0            3) cuda/8.0 

- GPU models and configuration:
 NVIDIA Corporation GP104 [GeForce GTX 1080] (rev a1)

- GCC version (if compiling from source):
5.3.0, 6.4.0
- CMake version:
3.6.1

- Versions of any other relevant libraries:
 protobuf/3.6.1
